channel.title: Rune Mtp (634) Npc Drop Rates
channel.description:
I have npc such as - dagannoths 150M - rock crabs 100K
They drop to much and my file is a .bin and if i change to .txt i still dont get a proper layout of the drop rates how can i fix it so i can change the drop rates

item.title: Rune Mtp (634) Npc Drop Rates
item.dc:creator: @ebert ebert
item.description:
@ebert wrote:

If you are using Rune mtp source there is a cmd file when u open the source to edit the drops it’s not that difficult right?

just put ID 1338 and u can change dagannoth drop rates… if u wona see the npc’s that spawn go in to the source Data\npcs\npcspawns… He made it so easy for the little coders ^^

If u need more help private message me teamviewer 7 or msn.

Read full topic

item.title: Rune Mtp (634) Npc Drop Rates
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

zingerman111:

its not PI is originaly a dementhium base

I don’t think you should be working with a cache higher than 317 if you can’t figure this out. That’s just my opinion though, and that isn’t helping you.

Read full topic

item.title: Rune Mtp (634) Npc Drop Rates
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

You can change the format in which the file is read from .bin to .txt. I doubt you’ll want to change it to a .txt. You might only need to change the path it uses to find it. Also, if you’re using PI, then the .bin file is probably the correct format.

Read full topic
